nodes.title: Why are planners so concerned with urban density?
nodes.summary: Density is a hot topic in urban design circles. Why is this so?

nodes.title: What types of urban densities are there?
nodes.summary: There a few types of density. It is useful to review the most common formulas

nodes.title: What about people who prefer to live in less dense cities?
nodes.summary: Not everyone wants an dense, urban lifestyle. Could people live in smaller, less dense (and quite likely more affordable) cities too?

nodes.title: Should cities attempt to achieve a standard density?
nodes.summary: If planners want density should builders build to a standard density?

nodes.title: Should the density of new cities be different from that of existing cities?
nodes.summary: Cities usually evolve over time becoming more or less dense as they grow. Will new cities be more dense or less dense than cities that came before?

nodes.title: Should lower density buildings always be replaced by higher density ones?
nodes.summary: Sed ut perspiclquasi archoluptas ni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt

nodes.title: Is density at odds with architectural heritage?
nodes.summary: It is possible to increase density as well as preserve heritage?
